SEC Notice of Effectiveness

Source: R/effectiveness.R
effectiveness.Rd

Returns the current Notice of Effectiveness from the most recently completed business day from here

effectiveness()

Value

a data.frame with each row as a submission with the following columns:

registration_number

file_href

registrant

registrant_href

filing_date

effective_date

division

type

Details

You can also see the same filings going further back by using `latest_filings()` specifying the type = "EFFECT"

Examples

effectiveness()
#>   registration_number
#> 1        \n333-224209
#> 2        \n333-225448
#> 3        \n333-225267
#> 4        \n333-223604
#> 5        \n333-224857
#> 6        \n333-215581
#>                                                                                               file_href
#> 1 https://www.sec.gov/cgi-bin/browse-edgar?action=getcompany&filenum=333-224209&owner=exclude&count=200
#> 2 https://www.sec.gov/cgi-bin/browse-edgar?action=getcompany&filenum=333-225448&owner=exclude&count=200
#> 3 https://www.sec.gov/cgi-bin/browse-edgar?action=getcompany&filenum=333-225267&owner=exclude&count=200
#> 4 https://www.sec.gov/cgi-bin/browse-edgar?action=getcompany&filenum=333-223604&owner=exclude&count=200
#> 5 https://www.sec.gov/cgi-bin/browse-edgar?action=getcompany&filenum=333-224857&owner=exclude&count=200
#> 6 https://www.sec.gov/cgi-bin/browse-edgar?action=getcompany&filenum=333-215581&owner=exclude&count=200
#>                                  registrant
